Description: Pottery lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with band of small circles. Shoulder has Greek inscription; below is a row of raised points. Nozzle-top decorated with cross between two ladder patterns. Narrow, pointed oval base-ring. Brown, micaceous clay covered with a red slip.
Curator's comments: Close: Wulff, O., 1909. ‘Altchristliche und mittelalterliche byzantinische und italienische Bildwerke’ I. Berlin : Reimer, 1290, from Thebes.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2226)
Associated names: Named in inscription: St Merkurios of Caesarea
